Class ec.e.file.EEditableDirectory 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.file.EDirectoryEntry
           |
           +----ec.e.file.EDirectoryBase
                   |
                   +----ec.e.file.EEditableDirectory
public class EEditableDirectory
extends EDirectoryBase
A sturdy representation of a directory providing arbitrary access to its contents.

asAccessibleDirectory()
Produce an EAccessibleDirectory representation of this same directory.
asReadableDirectory()
Produce an EReadableDirectory representation of this same directory.
contain(EEditableDirectory, EDirectoryEntry, String)
Move a file or directory into this directory.
contents()
Produce a hashtable describing the contents of this directory.
delete(EDirectoryEntry)
Remove a file or directory from this directory.
lookupDirectory(String)
Lookup a specific directory pathname relative to this directory.
lookupFile(String)
Lookup a specific file pathname relative to this directory.
mkdir(String)
Create a new subdirectory under this directory.
mkfile(String)
Create a new (empty) file in this directory.

asAccessibleDirectory 
  public EAccessibleDirectory asAccessibleDirectory()
Produce an EAccessibleDirectory representation of this same directory.
asReadableDirectory 
  public EReadableDirectory asReadableDirectory()
Produce an EReadableDirectory representation of this same directory.
Overrides:
asReadableDirectory in class EDirectoryBase
contain 
  public void contain(EEditableDirectory sourceDirectory,
                      EDirectoryEntry entry,
                      String name) throws IOException
Move a file or directory into this directory. Can also be used to rename a file or directory that is already in this directory.
Parameters:
sourceDirectory - An editable directory where the indicated directory entry is currently to be found. If this is 'this', the contain operation becomes a rename operation.
entry - An EDirectory entry describing the file or directory that is to be moved into this directory.
name - The name under which this entry should be known here.
contents 
  public ReadOnlyHashtable contents()
Produce a hashtable describing the contents of this directory.
Returns:
A Hashtable mapping names of directories to EEditableDirectory objects and names of files to EEditableFile objects.
Overrides:
contents in class EDirectoryBase
delete 
  public void delete(EDirectoryEntry entry) throws IOException
Remove a file or directory from this directory.
Parameters:
entry - An EDirectoryEntry describing the entry to be removed.
lookupDirectory 
  public EEditableDirectory lookupDirectory(String path) throws IOException
Lookup a specific directory pathname relative to this directory.
Parameters:
path - A pathname (in local format) for the file desired.
Returns:
An EEditableDirectory corresonding to the path in question.
lookupFile 
  public EEditableFile lookupFile(String path) throws IOException
Lookup a specific file pathname relative to this directory.
Parameters:
path - A pathname (in local format) for the file desired.
Returns:
An EEditableFile corresonding to the path in question.
mkdir 
  public EEditableDirectory mkdir(String name) throws IOException
Create a new subdirectory under this directory.
Parameters:
name - The name for the new subdirectory.
Returns:
An editable directory object describing the new directory.
mkfile 
  public EEditableFile mkfile(String name)
Create a new (empty) file in this directory. Actually, the file is not really created until it is opened; this method merely creates the possibility that the file might exist.
Parameters:
name - The name for the new file.
Returns:
An editable file object describing the new file.
